articles.title: Video: Daughter of Putin ally Alexander Dugin killed in car bomb outside Moscow - CNN Video
articles.description: Russian authorities say they have opened a murder investigation after the daughter of influential, ultra-nationalist philosopher Alexander Dugin was killed by a car bomb on the outskirts of Moscow. CNN's Fred Pleitgen has more.

articles.author: David Williams and Raja Razek, CNN
articles.title: Flash flooding at a national park in New Mexico forced the evacuation of about 160 people
articles.description: About 160 people had to shelter in place for hours at Carlsbad Caverns National Park in New Mexico due to flash flooding before they were evacuated Saturday, authorities said.
articles.content:

articles.title: More than 14 million people under flood watches Sunday
articles.description: After heavy rain and flash floods in parts of the Southwest this weekend, more than 14 million people across the southern Plains were under flood watches and warnings Sunday, including the Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex and Shreveport, Louisiana.

articles.title: Mother of Marine killed as the US quit Afghanistan now has to bury another son
articles.description: Lance Cpl. Kareem Nikoui was killed by terrorists in the chaotic US withdrawal from Afghanistan in August 2021. Not even a year later, his bereaved mother lost another son to the grief.

articles.title: Opinion: Some Russian and Chinese citizens are voting with their feet
articles.description: Putin and Xi will continue to claim their systems are superior to democracy. But those who disagree with them at home, unable to speak out, will either keep quiet, keep their criticism to barely-audible whispers, or vote with their feet, writes Frida Ghitis.

articles.title: Europe's largest nuclear plant is under threat. But experts say a Chernobyl-sized disaster is unlikely
articles.description: Shelling at the Zaporizhzhia plant in southern Ukraine has sparked fears of disaster. But nuclear experts told CNN that the main risk is closest to the complex itself, and doesn't justify Europe-wide alerts.
